comprehensive_overview: Multi-Locus Sequence Typing (MLST) is a molecular typing method that characterizes isolates by sequencing a set of housekeeping genes. MLST is widely used in microbial genotyping studies to investigate the genetic relationships between isolates and is particularly popular in epidemiological and population biology studies.
core_features: Characterizes isolates by sequencing housekeeping genes
Used for investigating genetic relationships between isolates
Popular in epidemiological and population biology studies
